00001 module bivar
00002 
00003 use types
00004 implicit none
00005 
00006 contains
00007 
00008 subroutine bivar_interp ( md, ncp, ndp, xd, yd, zd, nip, xi, yi, zi, iwk, wk )
00009 
00010 !*****************************************************************************80
00011 !
00012 !! IDBVIP performs bivariate interpolation of irregular X, Y data.
00013 !
00014 !  Discussion:
00015 !
00016 !    This subroutine performs bivariate interpolation when the projections
00017 !    of the data points in the XY plane are irregularly
00018 !    distributed in the plane.
00019 !
00020 !    The very first call to this subroutine and the call with a new
00021 !    NCP value, a new NDP value, or new contents of the XD and
00022 !    YD arrays must be made with MD = 1.  The call with MD = 2 must be
00023 !    preceded by another call with the same NCP and NDP values and
00024 !    with the same contents of the XD and YD arrays.  The call with
00025 !    MD = 3 must be preceded by another call with the same NCP, NDP,
00026 !    and NIP values and with the same contents of the XD, YD, XI,
00027 !    and YI arrays.  Between the call with MD = 2 or MD = 3 and its
00028 !    preceding call, the IWK and WK arrays must not be disturbed.
00029 !
00030 !  Modified:
00031 !
00032 !    27 August 2007
00033 !
00034 !  Author:
00035 !
00036 !    Hiroshi Akima
00037 !
00038 !  References:
00039 !
00040 !    Hiroshi Akima,
00041 !    Algorithm 526:
00042 !    A Method of Bivariate Interpolation and Smooth Surface Fitting
00043 !    for Values Given at Irregularly Distributed Points,
00044 !    ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software,
00045 !    Volume 4, Number 2, June 1978, pages 160-164.
00046 !
00047 !    Hiroshi Akima,
00048 !    On Estimating Partial Derivatives for Bivariate Interpolation
00049 !    of Scattered Data,
00050 !    Rocky Mountain Journal of Mathematics,
00051 !    Volume 14, Number 1, Winter 1984, pages 41-51.
00052 !
00053 !  Parameters:
00054 !
00055 !    Input, integer MD, mode of computation.   MD must be 1, 2 or 3.
00056 !    1 for new NCP and/or new XD, YD;
00057 !    2 for old NCP, old XD, YD, new XI, YI;
00058 !    3 for old NCP, old XD, YD, old XI, YI.
00059 !
00060 !    Input, integer NCP, the number of additional data points used for
00061 !    estimating partial derivatives at each data point.
00062 !    2 < =  NCP < NDP.  Reasonable values are 3 < =  NCP < =  5.
00063 !
00064 !    Input, integer NDP, the number of data points.
00065 !    4 < =  NDP.
00066 !
00067 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XD(NDP), Y(NDP), the X and Y coordinates
00068 !    of the data points.
00069 !
00070 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) ZD(NDP), the data values at the data points.
00071 !
00072 !    Input, integer NIP, the number of output points at which
00073 !    interpolation is to be performed.
00074 !    1 < =  NIP.
00075 !
00076 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XI(NIP), YI(NIP), the coordinates of the
00077 !    points at which interpolation is to be performed.
00078 !
00079 !    Output, real ( kind = 8 ) ZI(NIP), the interpolated data values.
00080 !
00081 !    Workspace, integer IWK(max(31,27+NCP)*NDP+NIP).
00082 !
00083 !    Workspace, real ( kind = 8 ) WK(8*NDP).
00084 !
00085   implicit none
00086 
00087   integer (kind=T_INT) :: ncp
00088   integer (kind=T_INT) :: ndp
00089   integer (kind=T_INT) :: nip
00090 
00091   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iip
00092   integer (kind=T_INT) :: itpv
00093   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iwk(max(31,27+ncp)*ndp+nip)
00094   integer (kind=T_INT) :: jwipc
00095   integer (kind=T_INT) :: jwipl
00096   integer (kind=T_INT) :: jwipt
00097   integer (kind=T_INT) :: jwit
00098   integer (kind=T_INT) :: jwit0
00099   integer (kind=T_INT) :: jwiwk
00100   integer (kind=T_INT) :: jwiwl
00101   integer (kind=T_INT) :: jwiwp
00102   integer (kind=T_INT) :: md
00103   integer (kind=T_INT) :: md0
00104   integer (kind=T_INT) :: ncp0
00105   integer (kind=T_INT) :: ncppv
00106   integer (kind=T_INT) :: ndp0
00107   integer (kind=T_INT) :: ndppv
00108   integer (kind=T_INT) :: nip0
00109   integer (kind=T_INT) :: nippv
00110   integer (kind=T_INT) :: nit
00111   integer (kind=T_INT) :: nl
00112   integer (kind=T_INT) :: nt
00113   real (kind = T_DBL) :: wk(8*ndp)
00114   real (kind = T_DBL) :: xd(ndp)
00115   real (kind = T_DBL) :: xi(nip)
00116   real (kind = T_DBL) :: yd(ndp)
00117   real (kind = T_DBL) :: yi(nip)
00118   real (kind = T_DBL) :: zd(ndp)
00119   real (kind = T_DBL) :: zi(nip)
00120 
00121   save /idlc/
00122   save /idpi/
00123 
00124   common /idlc/ nit
00125   common /idpi/ itpv
00126 !
00127 !  Setting of some input parameters to local variables,
00128 !  for MD = 1, 2, 3.
00129 !
00130   md0 = md
00131   ncp0 = ncp
00132   ndp0 = ndp
00133   nip0 = nip
00134 !
00135 !  Error check for MD = 1, 2, 3.
00136 !
00137   if ( md0 < 1 .or. 3 < md0 ) then
00138     write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00139     write ( *, '(a)' ) 'IDBVIP - Fatal error!'
00140     write ( *, '(a)' ) '  Improper input parameters.'
00141     write ( *, '(a)' ) '  MD < 1 or 3 < MD.'
00142     write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00143     write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  MD  = ', md0
00144     stop
00145   end if
00146 
00147   if ( ncp0 < 2 .or. ndp0 <= ncp0 ) then
00148     write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00149     write ( *, '(a)' ) 'IDBVIP - Fatal error!'
00150     write ( *, '(a)' ) '  Improper input parameters.'
00151     write ( *, '(a)' ) '  NCP < 2 or NDP <= NCP.'
00152     write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00153     write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  NCP = ', ncp0
00154     write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  NDP = ', ndp0
00155     stop
00156   end if
00157 
00158   if ( ndp0 < 4 ) then
00159     write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00160     write ( *, '(a)' ) 'IDBVIP - Fatal error!'
00161     write ( *, '(a)' ) '  Improper input parameters.'
00162     write ( *, '(a)' ) '  NDP < 4.'
00163     write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00164     write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  NDP = ', ndp0
00165     stop
00166   end if
00167 
00168   if ( nip0 < 1 ) then
00169     write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00170     write ( *, '(a)' ) 'IDBVIP - Fatal error!'
00171     write ( *, '(a)' ) '  NIP < 1.'
00172     write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00173     write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  NIP = ', nip0
00174     stop
00175   end if
00176 
00177   if ( md0 < 2 ) then
00178 
00179     iwk(1) = ncp0
00180     iwk(2) = ndp0
00181 
00182   else
00183 
00184     ncppv = iwk(1)
00185     ndppv = iwk(2)
00186 
00187     if ( ncp0 /= ncppv ) then
00188       write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00189       write ( *, '(a)' ) 'IDBVIP - Fatal error!'
00190       write ( *, '(a)' ) '  Improper input parameters.'
00191       write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00192       write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  NCP   = ', ncp0
00193       write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  NCPPV = ', ncppv
00194       stop
00195     end if
00196 
00197     if ( ndp0 /= ndppv ) then
00198       write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00199       write ( *, '(a)' ) 'IDBVIP - Fatal error!'
00200       write ( *, '(a)' ) '  Improper input parameters.'
00201       write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00202       write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  NDP   = ', ndp0
00203       write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  NDPPV = ', ndppv
00204       stop
00205     end if
00206 
00207   end if
00208 
00209   if ( md0 < 3 ) then
00210 
00211     iwk(3) = nip
00212 
00213   else
00214 
00215     nippv = iwk(3)
00216 
00217     if ( nip0 /= nippv ) then
00218       write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00219       write ( *, '(a)' ) 'IDBVIP - Fatal error!'
00220       write ( *, '(a)' ) '  Improper input parameters.'
00221       write ( *, '(a)' ) ' '
00222       write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  NIP   = ', nip0
00223       write ( *, '(a,i8)' ) '  NIPPV = ', nippv
00224       stop
00225     end if
00226 
00227   end if
00228 !
00229 !  Allocation of storage areas in the IWK array, for MD = 1, 2, 3.
00230 !
00231   jwipt = 16
00232   jwiwl = 6 * ndp0 + 1
00233   jwiwk = jwiwl
00234   jwipl = 24 * ndp0 + 1
00235   jwiwp = 30 * ndp0 + 1
00236   jwipc = 27 * ndp0 + 1
00237   jwit0 = max ( 31, 27 + ncp0 ) * ndp0
00238 !
00239 !  Triangulate the XY plane, for MD = 1.
00240 !
00241   if ( md0 == 1 ) then
00242 
00243     call idtang ( ndp0, xd, yd, nt, iwk(jwipt), nl, iwk(jwipl), &
00244       iwk(jwiwl), iwk(jwiwp), wk )
00245 
00246     iwk(5) = nt
00247     iwk(6) = nl
00248 
00249     if ( nt == 0 ) then
00250       return
00251     end if
00252 
00253   end if
00254 !
00255 !  Determine NCP points closest to each data point, for MD = 1.
00256 !
00257   if ( md0 <= 1 ) then
00258 
00259     call idcldp ( ndp0, xd, yd, ncp0, iwk(jwipc) )
00260 
00261     if ( iwk(jwipc) == 0 ) then
00262       return
00263     end if
00264 
00265   end if
00266 !
00267 !  Locate all points at which interpolation is to be performed,
00268 !  for MD = 1, 2.
00269 !
00270   if ( md0 /= 3 ) then
00271 
00272     nit = 0
00273     jwit = jwit0
00274 
00275     do iip = 1, nip0
00276       jwit = jwit + 1
00277       call idlctn ( ndp0, xd, yd, nt, iwk(jwipt), nl, iwk(jwipl), &
00278         xi(iip), yi(iip), iwk(jwit), iwk(jwiwk), wk )
00279     end do
00280 
00281   end if
00282 !
00283 !  Estimate partial derivatives at all data points,
00284 !  for MD = 1, 2, 3.
00285 !
00286   call idpdrv ( ndp0, xd, yd, zd, ncp0, iwk(jwipc), wk )
00287 !
00288 !  Interpolate the ZI values, for MD = 1,2,3;
00289 !
00290   itpv = 0
00291   jwit = jwit0
00292 
00293   do iip = 1, nip0
00294     jwit = jwit + 1
00295     call idptip ( xd, yd, zd, nt, iwk(jwipt), nl, iwk(jwipl), wk, &
00296       iwk(jwit), xi(iip), yi(iip), zi(iip) )
00297   end do
00298 
00299   return
00300 end subroutine bivar_interp
00301 
00302 !----------------------------------------------------------------------
00303 
00304 subroutine idcldp ( ndp, xd, yd, ncp, ipc )
00305 
00306 !*****************************************************************************80
00307 !
00308 !! IDCLDP selects several neighbors of a given data point.
00309 !
00310 !  Discussion:
00311 !
00312 !    This subroutine selects several data points that are closest
00313 !    to each of the data point.
00314 !
00315 !  Modified:
00316 !
00317 !    27 August 2007
00318 !
00319 !  Author:
00320 !
00321 !    Hiroshi Akima
00322 !
00323 !  References:
00324 !
00325 !    Hiroshi Akima,
00326 !    Algorithm 526:
00327 !    A Method of Bivariate Interpolation and Smooth Surface Fitting
00328 !    for Values Given at Irregularly Distributed Points,
00329 !    ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software,
00330 !    Volume 4, Number 2, June 1978, pages 160-164.
00331 !
00332 !    Hiroshi Akima,
00333 !    On Estimating Partial Derivatives for Bivariate Interpolation
00334 !    of Scattered Data,
00335 !    Rocky Mountain Journal of Mathematics,
00336 !    Volume 14, Number 1, Winter 1984, pages 41-51.
00337 !
00338 !  Parameters:
00339 !
00340 !    Input, integer NDP, the number of data points.
00341 !    4 < =  NDP.
00342 !
00343 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XD(NDP), Y(NDP), the X and Y coordinates
00344 !    of the data points.
00345 !
00346 !    Input, integer NCP, the number of additional data points used for
00347 !    estimating partial derivatives at each data point.
00348 !
00349 !    Output, integer IPC(NCP*NDP), the indices of NCP data points closest
00350 !    to each of the NDP data points.
00351 !
00352   implicit none
00353 
00354   integer ncp
00355   integer ndp
00356 
00357   real ( kind = 8 ) dsq0(ncp)
00358   real ( kind = 8 ) dsqf
00359   real ( kind = 8 ) dsqi
00360   real ( kind = 8 ) dsqmn
00361   real ( kind = 8 ) dsqmx
00362   real ( kind = 8 ) dx12
00363   real ( kind = 8 ) dx13
00364   real ( kind = 8 ) dy12
00365   real ( kind = 8 ) dy13
00366   integer ip1
00367   integer ip2
00368   integer ip2mn
00369   integer ip3
00370   integer ip3mn
00371   integer ipc(ncp*ndp)
00372   integer ipc0(ncp)
00373   integer j1
00374   integer j2
00375   integer j3
00376   integer j4
00377   integer jmx
00378   integer nclpt
00379   integer ncp0
00380   integer ndp0
00381   real ( kind = 8 ) u1
00382   real ( kind = 8 ) u2
00383   real ( kind = 8 ) v1
00384   real ( kind = 8 ) v2
00385   real ( kind = 8 ) x1
00386   real ( kind = 8 ) xd(ndp)
00387   real ( kind = 8 ) y1
00388   real ( kind = 8 ) yd(ndp)
00389 !
00390 !  Statement function.
00391 !
00392   dsqf ( u1, v1, u2, v2 ) = ( u2 - u1 )**2 + ( v2 - v1 )**2
00393 !
00394 !  Preliminary processing.
00395 !
00396   ndp0 = ndp
00397   ncp0 = ncp
00398   if(ndp0<2)  go to 90
00399   if(ncp0<1.or.ncp0>=ndp0)    go to 90
00400 !
00401 !  Calculation.
00402 !
00403       do ip1 = 1, ndp0
00404 !
00405 !  Select NCP points.
00406 !
00407         x1 = xd(ip1)
00408         y1 = yd(ip1)
00409         j1 = 0
00410         dsqmx = 0.0D+00
00411 
00412         do ip2 = 1,ndp0
00413 
00414           if(ip2==ip1) then
00415             cycle
00416           end if
00417 
00418           dsqi = dsqf(x1,y1,xd(ip2),yd(ip2))
00419           j1 = j1+1
00420           dsq0(j1) = dsqi
00421           ipc0(j1) = ip2
00422 
00423           if ( dsqmx < dsqi ) then
00424             dsqmx = dsqi
00425             jmx = j1
00426           end if
00427 
00428           if(j1>=ncp0) then
00429             exit
00430           end if
00431 
00432         end do
00433 
00434         ip2mn = ip2+1
00435 
00436         do ip2 = ip2mn,ndp0
00437 
00438           if(ip2==ip1) then
00439             cycle
00440           end if
00441 
00442           dsqi = dsqf(x1,y1,xd(ip2),yd(ip2))
00443 
00444           if(dsqi>=dsqmx) then
00445             cycle
00446           end if
00447 
00448           dsq0(jmx) = dsqi
00449           ipc0(jmx) = ip2
00450           dsqmx = 0.0D+00
00451 
00452           do j1 = 1,ncp0
00453             if ( dsqmx < dsq0(j1) ) then
00454               dsqmx = dsq0(j1)
00455               jmx = j1
00456             end if
00457           end do
00458 
00459         end do
00460 !
00461 !  Check if all the NCP+1 points are collinear.
00462 !
00463         ip2 = ipc0(1)
00464         dx12 = xd(ip2)-x1
00465         dy12 = yd(ip2)-y1
00466 
00467         do j3 = 2,ncp0
00468           ip3 = ipc0(j3)
00469           dx13 = xd(ip3)-x1
00470           dy13 = yd(ip3)-y1
00471           if((dy13*dx12-dx13*dy12)/=0.0D+00 )    go to 50
00472         end do
00473 !
00474 !  Search for the closest noncollinear point.
00475 !
00476    40   nclpt = 0
00477 
00478         do 43  ip3 = 1,ndp0
00479 
00480           if ( ip3 == ip1 ) then
00481             cycle
00482           end if
00483 
00484           do j4 = 1,ncp0
00485             if(ip3==ipc0(j4))     go to 43
00486           end do
00487 
00488           dx13 = xd(ip3)-x1
00489           dy13 = yd(ip3)-y1
00490           if((dy13*dx12-dx13*dy12)==0.0D+00 )    go to 43
00491           dsqi = dsqf(x1,y1,xd(ip3),yd(ip3))
00492           if(nclpt==0)       go to 42
00493           if(dsqi>=dsqmn)    go to 43
00494    42     nclpt = 1
00495           dsqmn = dsqi
00496           ip3mn = ip3
00497 
00498    43   continue
00499 
00500         if(nclpt==0)    go to 91
00501 
00502         dsqmx = dsqmn
00503         ipc0(jmx) = ip3mn
00504 !
00505 !  Replace the local array for the output array.
00506 !
00507    50   j1 = (ip1-1)*ncp0
00508 
00509         do j2 = 1,ncp0
00510           j1 = j1+1
00511           ipc(j1) = ipc0(j2)
00512         end do
00513 
00514       end do
00515 
00516       return
00517 !
00518 !  error exit
00519 !
00520    90 write ( *, 2090 )
00521       go to 92
00522    91 write ( *,2091)
00523    92 write ( *,2092)  ndp0,ncp0
00524       ipc(1) = 0
00525       return
00526  2090 format(1x/' ***   improper input parameter value(s).')
00527  2091 format(1x/' ***   all collinear data points.')
00528  2092 format('   ndp  = ',i5,5x,'ncp  = ',i5/ &
00529          ' error detected in routine   idcldp'/)
00530       end subroutine idcldp
00531 
00532 
00533 
00534       subroutine idgrid ( xd, yd, nt, ipt, nl, ipl, nxi, nyi, xi, yi, ngp, igp )
00535 
00536 !*****************************************************************************80
00537 !
00538 !! IDGRID organizes grid points for surface fitting.
00539 !
00540 !  Discussion:
00541 !
00542 !    This subroutine organizes grid points for surface fitting by
00543 !    sorting them in ascending order of triangle numbers and of the
00544 !    border line segment number.
00545 !
00546 !  Modified:
00547 !
00548 !    24 August 2007
00549 !
00550 !  Author:
00551 !
00552 !    Hiroshi Akima
00553 !
00554 !  References:
00555 !
00556 !    Hiroshi Akima,
00557 !    Algorithm 526:
00558 !    A Method of Bivariate Interpolation and Smooth Surface Fitting
00559 !    for Values Given at Irregularly Distributed Points,
00560 !    ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software,
00561 !    Volume 4, Number 2, June 1978, pages 160-164.
00562 !
00563 !    Hiroshi Akima,
00564 !    On Estimating Partial Derivatives for Bivariate Interpolation
00565 !    of Scattered Data,
00566 !    Rocky Mountain Journal of Mathematics,
00567 !    Volume 14, Number 1, Winter 1984, pages 41-51.
00568 !
00569 !  Parameters:
00570 !
00571 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XD(NDP), Y(NDP), the X and Y coordinates
00572 !    of the data points.
00573 !
00574 !    Input, integer NT, the number of triangles.
00575 !
00576 !    Input, integer IPT(3*NT), the indices of the triangle vertexes.
00577 !
00578 !    Input, integer NL, the number of border line segments.
00579 !
00580 !    Input, integer IPL(3*NL), containing the point numbers of the end points
00581 !    of the border line segments and their respective triangle numbers,
00582 !
00583 !    Input, integer NXI, NYI, the number of grid points in the X and Y
00584 !    coordinates.
00585 !
00586 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XI(NXI), YI(NYI), the coordinates of the
00587 !    grid points.
00588 !
00589 !    Output, integer NGP(2*(NT+2*NL)) where the
00590 !    number of grid points that belong to each of the
00591 !    triangles or of the border line segments are to be stored.
00592 !
00593 !    Output, integer IGP(NXI*NYI), where the grid point numbers are to be
00594 !    stored in ascending order of the triangle number and the border line
00595 !    segment number.
00596 !
00597   implicit none
00598 
00599   integer nl
00600   integer nt
00601   integer nxi
00602   integer nyi
00603 
00604   integer igp(nxi*nyi)
00605   integer il0
00606   integer il0t3
00607   integer ilp1
00608   integer ilp1t3
00609   integer insd
00610   integer ip1
00611   integer ip2
00612   integer ip3
00613   integer ipl(3*nl)
00614   integer ipt(3*nt)
00615   integer it0
00616   integer it0t3
00617   integer ixi
00618   integer iximx
00619   integer iximn
00620   integer iyi
00621   integer izi
00622   integer jigp0
00623   integer jigp1
00624   integer jigp1i
00625   integer jngp0
00626   integer jngp1
00627   integer l
00628   integer ngp(2*nt+4*nl)
00629   integer ngp0
00630   integer ngp1
00631   integer nl0
00632   integer nt0
00633   integer nxi0
00634   integer nxinyi
00635   integer nyi0
00636   real ( kind = 8 ) side
00637   real ( kind = 8 ) spdt
00638   real ( kind = 8 ) u1
00639   real ( kind = 8 ) u2
00640   real ( kind = 8 ) u3
00641   real ( kind = 8 ) v1
00642   real ( kind = 8 ) v2
00643   real ( kind = 8 ) v3
00644   real ( kind = 8 ) x1
00645   real ( kind = 8 ) x2
00646   real ( kind = 8 ) x3
00647   real ( kind = 8 ) xd(*)
00648   real ( kind = 8 ) xi(nxi)
00649   real ( kind = 8 ) xii
00650   real ( kind = 8 ) ximn
00651   real ( kind = 8 ) ximx
00652   real ( kind = 8 ) xmn
00653   real ( kind = 8 ) xmx
00654   real ( kind = 8 ) y1
00655   real ( kind = 8 ) y2
00656   real ( kind = 8 ) y3
00657   real ( kind = 8 ) yd(*)
00658   real ( kind = 8 ) yi(nyi)
00659   real ( kind = 8 ) yii
00660   real ( kind = 8 ) yimn
00661   real ( kind = 8 ) yimx
00662   real ( kind = 8 ) ymn
00663   real ( kind = 8 ) ymx
00664 !
00665 !  Statement functions.
00666 !
00667       side(u1,v1,u2,v2,u3,v3) = (u1-u3)*(v2-v3) - (v1-v3)*(u2-u3)
00668       spdt(u1,v1,u2,v2,u3,v3) = (u1-u2)*(u3-u2) + (v1-v2)*(v3-v2)
00669 !
00670 !  Preliminary processing.
00671 !
00672       nt0 = nt
00673       nl0 = nl
00674       nxi0 = nxi
00675       nyi0 = nyi
00676       nxinyi = nxi0*nyi0
00677       ximn = min (xi(1),xi(nxi0))
00678       ximx = max (xi(1),xi(nxi0))
00679       yimn = min (yi(1),yi(nyi0))
00680       yimx = max (yi(1),yi(nyi0))
00681 !
00682 !  Determine grid points inside the data area.
00683 !
00684       jngp0 = 0
00685       jngp1 = 2*(nt0+2*nl0) + 1
00686       jigp0 = 0
00687       jigp1 = nxinyi + 1
00688 
00689       do 160 it0 = 1,nt0
00690 
00691         ngp0 = 0
00692         ngp1 = 0
00693         it0t3 = it0*3
00694         ip1 = ipt(it0t3-2)
00695         ip2 = ipt(it0t3-1)
00696         ip3 = ipt(it0t3)
00697         x1 = xd(ip1)
00698         y1 = yd(ip1)
00699         x2 = xd(ip2)
00700         y2 = yd(ip2)
00701         x3 = xd(ip3)
00702         y3 = yd(ip3)
00703         xmn = min (x1,x2,x3)
00704         xmx = max (x1,x2,x3)
00705         ymn = min (y1,y2,y3)
00706         ymx = max (y1,y2,y3)
00707         insd = 0
00708 
00709         do 20 ixi = 1,nxi0
00710           if (xi(ixi)>=xmn .and. xi(ixi)<=xmx) go to 10
00711           if (insd==0) go to 20
00712           iximx = ixi - 1
00713           go to 30
00714    10     if (insd==1) go to 20
00715           insd = 1
00716           iximn = ixi
00717    20   continue
00718 
00719         if (insd==0) go to 150
00720         iximx = nxi0
00721 
00722    30   do 140 iyi = 1,nyi0
00723 
00724           yii = yi(iyi)
00725           if (yii<ymn .or. yii>ymx) go to 140
00726 
00727           do 130 ixi = iximn,iximx
00728 
00729             xii = xi(ixi)
00730             l = 0
00731             if (side(x1,y1,x2,y2,xii,yii)) 130, 40, 50
00732    40       l = 1
00733    50       if (side(x2,y2,x3,y3,xii,yii)) 130, 60, 70
00734    60       l = 1
00735    70       if (side(x3,y3,x1,y1,xii,yii)) 130, 80, 90
00736    80       l = 1
00737    90       izi = nxi0*(iyi-1) + ixi
00738             if (l==1) go to 100
00739             ngp0 = ngp0 + 1
00740             jigp0 = jigp0 + 1
00741             igp(jigp0) = izi
00742             go to 130
00743 
00744   100       continue
00745 
00746             do jigp1i = jigp1,nxinyi
00747               if (izi==igp(jigp1i)) go to 130
00748             end do
00749 
00750   120       ngp1 = ngp1 + 1
00751             jigp1 = jigp1 - 1
00752             igp(jigp1) = izi
00753   130     continue
00754   140   continue
00755   150   jngp0 = jngp0 + 1
00756         ngp(jngp0) = ngp0
00757         jngp1 = jngp1 - 1
00758         ngp(jngp1) = ngp1
00759 
00760   160 continue
00761 !
00762 !  Determine grid points outside the data area.
00763 !  in semi-infinite rectangular area.
00764 !
00765       do 450 il0 = 1,nl0
00766 
00767         ngp0 = 0
00768         ngp1 = 0
00769         il0t3 = il0*3
00770         ip1 = ipl(il0t3-2)
00771         ip2 = ipl(il0t3-1)
00772         x1 = xd(ip1)
00773         y1 = yd(ip1)
00774         x2 = xd(ip2)
00775         y2 = yd(ip2)
00776         xmn = ximn
00777         xmx = ximx
00778         ymn = yimn
00779         ymx = yimx
00780 
00781         if (y2>=y1) xmn = min (x1,x2)
00782         if (y2<=y1) xmx = max (x1,x2)
00783         if (x2<=x1) ymn = min (y1,y2)
00784         if (x2>=x1) ymx = max (y1,y2)
00785         insd = 0
00786 
00787         do 180 ixi = 1,nxi0
00788 
00789           if (xi(ixi)>=xmn .and. xi(ixi)<=xmx) go to 170
00790           if (insd==0) go to 180
00791           iximx = ixi - 1
00792           go to 190
00793   170     continue
00794 
00795           if ( insd /= 1 ) then
00796             insd = 1
00797             iximn = ixi
00798           end if
00799 
00800   180   continue
00801 
00802         if (insd==0) go to 310
00803         iximx = nxi0
00804 
00805   190   do 300 iyi = 1,nyi0
00806 
00807           yii = yi(iyi)
00808           if (yii<ymn .or. yii>ymx) go to 300
00809 
00810           do 290 ixi = iximn,iximx
00811 
00812             xii = xi(ixi)
00813             l = 0
00814             if (side(x1,y1,x2,y2,xii,yii)) 210, 200, 290
00815   200       l = 1
00816   210       if (spdt(x2,y2,x1,y1,xii,yii)) 290, 220, 230
00817   220       l = 1
00818   230       if (spdt(x1,y1,x2,y2,xii,yii)) 290, 240, 250
00819   240       l = 1
00820   250       izi = nxi0*(iyi-1) + ixi
00821             if (l==1) go to 260
00822             ngp0 = ngp0 + 1
00823             jigp0 = jigp0 + 1
00824             igp(jigp0) = izi
00825             go to 290
00826   260       continue
00827 
00828             do jigp1i = jigp1,nxinyi
00829               if (izi==igp(jigp1i)) go to 290
00830             end do
00831 
00832             ngp1 = ngp1 + 1
00833             jigp1 = jigp1 - 1
00834             igp(jigp1) = izi
00835 
00836   290     continue
00837 
00838   300   continue
00839 
00840   310   jngp0 = jngp0 + 1
00841         ngp(jngp0) = ngp0
00842         jngp1 = jngp1 - 1
00843         ngp(jngp1) = ngp1
00844 !
00845 !  In semi-infinite triangular area.
00846 !
00847         ngp0 = 0
00848         ngp1 = 0
00849         ilp1 = mod(il0,nl0) + 1
00850         ilp1t3 = ilp1*3
00851         ip3 = ipl(ilp1t3-1)
00852         x3 = xd(ip3)
00853         y3 = yd(ip3)
00854         xmn = ximn
00855         xmx = ximx
00856         ymn = yimn
00857         ymx = yimx
00858         if (y3>=y2 .and. y2>=y1) xmn = x2
00859         if (y3<=y2 .and. y2<=y1) xmx = x2
00860         if (x3<=x2 .and. x2<=x1) ymn = y2
00861         if (x3>=x2 .and. x2>=x1) ymx = y2
00862         insd = 0
00863 
00864         do 330 ixi = 1,nxi0
00865           if (xi(ixi)>=xmn .and. xi(ixi)<=xmx) go to 320
00866           if (insd==0) go to 330
00867           iximx = ixi - 1
00868           go to 340
00869   320     continue
00870 
00871           if ( insd /= 1 ) then
00872             insd = 1
00873             iximn = ixi
00874           end if
00875 
00876   330   continue
00877 
00878         if (insd==0) go to 440
00879 
00880         iximx = nxi0
00881   340   do 430 iyi = 1,nyi0
00882           yii = yi(iyi)
00883           if (yii<ymn .or. yii>ymx) go to 430
00884           do 420 ixi = iximn,iximx
00885             xii = xi(ixi)
00886             l = 0
00887             if (spdt(x1,y1,x2,y2,xii,yii)) 360, 350, 420
00888   350       l = 1
00889   360       if (spdt(x3,y3,x2,y2,xii,yii)) 380, 370, 420
00890   370       l = 1
00891   380       izi = nxi0*(iyi-1) + ixi
00892             if (l==1) go to 390
00893             ngp0 = ngp0 + 1
00894             jigp0 = jigp0 + 1
00895             igp(jigp0) = izi
00896             go to 420
00897   390       continue
00898             do jigp1i = jigp1,nxinyi
00899               if (izi==igp(jigp1i)) go to 420
00900             end do
00901             ngp1 = ngp1 + 1
00902             jigp1 = jigp1 - 1
00903             igp(jigp1) = izi
00904   420     continue
00905 
00906   430   continue
00907 
00908   440   jngp0 = jngp0 + 1
00909         ngp(jngp0) = ngp0
00910         jngp1 = jngp1 - 1
00911         ngp(jngp1) = ngp1
00912 
00913   450 continue
00914 
00915       return
00916       end subroutine idgrid
00917 
00918 
00919       subroutine idlctn ( ndp, xd, yd, nt, ipt, nl, ipl, xii, yii, iti, &
00920         iwk, wk)
00921 
00922 !*****************************************************************************80
00923 !
00924 !! IDLCTN finds the triangle that contains a point.
00925 !
00926 !  Discussion:
00927 !
00928 !    This subroutine locates a point, that is, determines to what triangle
00929 !    a given point (XII,YII) belongs.  When the given point
00930 !    does not lie inside the data area, this subroutine determines
00931 !    the border line segment when the point lies in an outside
00932 !    rectangular area, and two border line segments when the point
00933 !    lies in an outside triangular area.
00934 !
00935 !  Modified:
00936 !
00937 !    24 August 2007
00938 !
00939 !  Author:
00940 !
00941 !    Hiroshi Akima
00942 !
00943 !  References:
00944 !
00945 !    Hiroshi Akima,
00946 !    Algorithm 526:
00947 !    A Method of Bivariate Interpolation and Smooth Surface Fitting
00948 !    for Values Given at Irregularly Distributed Points,
00949 !    ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software,
00950 !    Volume 4, Number 2, June 1978, pages 160-164.
00951 !
00952 !    Hiroshi Akima,
00953 !    On Estimating Partial Derivatives for Bivariate Interpolation
00954 !    of Scattered Data,
00955 !    Rocky Mountain Journal of Mathematics,
00956 !    Volume 14, Number 1, Winter 1984, pages 41-51.
00957 !
00958 !  Parameters:
00959 !
00960 !    Input, integer NDP, the number of data points.
00961 !    4 < =  NDP.
00962 !
00963 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XD(NDP), Y(NDP), the X and Y coordinates
00964 !    of the data points.
00965 !
00966 !    Input, integer NT, the number of triangles.
00967 !
00968 !    Input, integer IPT(3*NT), the point numbers of the vertexes of
00969 !    the triangles,
00970 !
00971 !    Input, integer NL, the number of border line segments.
00972 !
00973 !    Input, integer IPL(3*NL), the point numbers of the end points of
00974 !    the border line segments and their respective triangle numbers.
00975 !
00976 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XII, YII, the coordinates of the point
00977 !    to be located.
00978 !
00979 !    Output, integer ITI, the triangle number, when the point is inside the
00980 !    data area, or two border line segment numbers, il1 and il2,
00981 !    coded to il1*(nt+nl)+il2, when the point is outside the data area.
00982 !
00983 !    Input/output, integer IWK(18*NDP), real ( kind = 8 ) WK(8*NDP),
00984 !    arrays that contain information about the triangulation of the data.
00985 !    These arrays are set up on the first call to IDLCTN for a given set of
00986 !    data; the data should not be altered by the user between calls for the
00987 !    same set of data, as it will be reused rather than being recomputed.
00988 !
00989   implicit none
00990 
00991   integer ndp
00992   integer nt
00993   integer nl
00994 
00995   integer i1
00996   integer i2
00997   integer i3
00998   integer idp
00999   integer idsc(9)
01000   integer il1
01001   integer il1t3
01002   integer il2
01003   integer ip1
01004   integer ip2
01005   integer ip3
01006   integer ipl(3*nl)
01007   integer ipt(3*nt)
01008   integer isc
01009   integer it0
01010   integer it0t3
01011   integer iti
01012   integer itipv
01013   integer itsc
01014   integer iwk(18*ndp)
01015   integer jiwk
01016   integer jwk
01017   integer ndp0
01018   integer nit
01019   integer nl0
01020   integer nt0
01021   integer ntl
01022   integer ntsc(9)
01023   integer ntsci
01024   real ( kind = 8 ) side
01025   real ( kind = 8 ) spdt
01026   real ( kind = 8 ) u1
01027   real ( kind = 8 ) u2
01028   real ( kind = 8 ) u3
01029   real ( kind = 8 ) v1
01030   real ( kind = 8 ) v2
01031   real ( kind = 8 ) v3
01032   real ( kind = 8 ) wk(8*ndp)
01033   real ( kind = 8 ) x0
01034   real ( kind = 8 ) x1
01035   real ( kind = 8 ) x2
01036   real ( kind = 8 ) x3
01037   real ( kind = 8 ) xd(ndp)
01038   real ( kind = 8 ) xi
01039   real ( kind = 8 ) xii
01040   real ( kind = 8 ) xmn
01041   real ( kind = 8 ) xmx
01042   real ( kind = 8 ) xs1
01043   real ( kind = 8 ) xs2
01044   real ( kind = 8 ) y0
01045   real ( kind = 8 ) y1
01046   real ( kind = 8 ) y2
01047   real ( kind = 8 ) y3
01048   real ( kind = 8 ) yd(ndp)
01049   real ( kind = 8 ) yi
01050   real ( kind = 8 ) yii
01051   real ( kind = 8 ) ymn
01052   real ( kind = 8 ) ymx
01053   real ( kind = 8 ) ys1
01054   real ( kind = 8 ) ys2
01055 
01056   save /idlc/
01057 
01058   common /idlc/ nit
01059 !
01060 !  Statement functions.
01061 !
01062       side(u1,v1,u2,v2,u3,v3) = (u1-u3)*(v2-v3) - (v1-v3)*(u2-u3)
01063 
01064       spdt(u1,v1,u2,v2,u3,v3) = (u1-u2)*(u3-u2) + (v1-v2)*(v3-v2)
01065 !
01066 !  Preliminary processing.
01067 !
01068       ndp0 = ndp
01069       nt0 = nt
01070       nl0 = nl
01071       ntl = nt0 + nl0
01072       x0 = xii
01073       y0 = yii
01074 !
01075 !  Processing for a new set of data points.
01076 !
01077       if ( nit/=0) go to 80
01078 
01079       nit = 1
01080 !
01081 !  Divide the XY plane into nine rectangular sections.
01082 !
01083       xmn = xd(1)
01084       xmx = xmn
01085       ymn = yd(1)
01086       ymx = ymn
01087 
01088       do idp = 2,ndp0
01089         xi = xd(idp)
01090         yi = yd(idp)
01091         xmn = min (xi,xmn)
01092         xmx = max (xi,xmx)
01093         ymn = min (yi,ymn)
01094         ymx = max (yi,ymx)
01095       end do
01096 
01097       xs1 = ( xmn + xmn + xmx ) / 3.0D+00
01098       xs2 = ( xmn + xmx + xmx ) / 3.0D+00
01099       ys1 = ( ymn + ymn + ymx ) / 3.0D+00
01100       ys2 = ( ymn + ymx + ymx ) / 3.0D+00
01101 !
01102 !  Determine and store in the IWK array triangle numbers of
01103 !  the triangles associated with each of the nine sections.
01104 !
01105       ntsc(1:9) = 0
01106       idsc(1:9) = 0
01107 
01108       it0t3 = 0
01109       jwk = 0
01110 
01111       do 70 it0 = 1,nt0
01112 
01113         it0t3 = it0t3 + 3
01114         i1 = ipt(it0t3-2)
01115         i2 = ipt(it0t3-1)
01116         i3 = ipt(it0t3)
01117         xmn = min (xd(i1),xd(i2),xd(i3))
01118         xmx = max (xd(i1),xd(i2),xd(i3))
01119         ymn = min (yd(i1),yd(i2),yd(i3))
01120         ymx = max (yd(i1),yd(i2),yd(i3))
01121         if (ymn>ys1) go to 30
01122         if (xmn<=xs1) idsc(1) = 1
01123         if (xmx>=xs1 .and. xmn<=xs2) idsc(2) = 1
01124         if (xmx>=xs2) idsc(3) = 1
01125    30   if (ymx<ys1 .or. ymn>ys2) go to 40
01126         if (xmn<=xs1) idsc(4) = 1
01127         if (xmx>=xs1 .and. xmn<=xs2) idsc(5) = 1
01128         if (xmx>=xs2) idsc(6) = 1
01129    40   if (ymx<ys2) go to 50
01130         if (xmn<=xs1) idsc(7) = 1
01131         if (xmx>=xs1 .and. xmn<=xs2) idsc(8) = 1
01132         if (xmx>=xs2) idsc(9) = 1
01133    50   continue
01134 
01135         do isc = 1,9
01136           if ( idsc(isc) /= 0 ) then
01137             jiwk = 9*ntsc(isc) + isc
01138             iwk(jiwk) = it0
01139             ntsc(isc) = ntsc(isc) + 1
01140             idsc(isc) = 0
01141           end if
01142         end do
01143 !
01144 !  Store in the WK array the minimum and maximum of the X and
01145 !  Y coordinate values for each of the triangle.
01146 !
01147         jwk = jwk + 4
01148         wk(jwk-3) = xmn
01149         wk(jwk-2) = xmx
01150         wk(jwk-1) = ymn
01151         wk(jwk) = ymx
01152 
01153    70 continue
01154 
01155       go to 110
01156 !
01157 !  Check if in the same triangle as previous.
01158 !
01159    80 it0 = itipv
01160       if (it0>nt0) go to 90
01161       it0t3 = it0*3
01162       ip1 = ipt(it0t3-2)
01163       x1 = xd(ip1)
01164       y1 = yd(ip1)
01165       ip2 = ipt(it0t3-1)
01166       x2 = xd(ip2)
01167       y2 = yd(ip2)
01168       if (side(x1,y1,x2,y2,x0,y0)<0.0D+00 ) go to 110
01169       ip3 = ipt(it0t3)
01170       x3 = xd(ip3)
01171       y3 = yd(ip3)
01172       if (side(x2,y2,x3,y3,x0,y0)<0.0D+00 ) go to 110
01173       if (side(x3,y3,x1,y1,x0,y0)<0.0D+00 ) go to 110
01174       go to 170
01175 !
01176 !  Check if on the same border line segment.
01177 !
01178    90 il1 = it0/ntl
01179       il2 = it0 - il1*ntl
01180       il1t3 = il1*3
01181       ip1 = ipl(il1t3-2)
01182       x1 = xd(ip1)
01183       y1 = yd(ip1)
01184       ip2 = ipl(il1t3-1)
01185       x2 = xd(ip2)
01186       y2 = yd(ip2)
01187       if (il2/=il1) go to 100
01188       if (spdt(x1,y1,x2,y2,x0,y0)<0.0D+00 ) go to 110
01189       if (spdt(x2,y2,x1,y1,x0,y0)<0.0D+00 ) go to 110
01190       if (side(x1,y1,x2,y2,x0,y0)>0.0D+00 ) go to 110
01191       go to 170
01192 !
01193 !  Check if between the same two border line segments.
01194 !
01195   100 if (spdt(x1,y1,x2,y2,x0,y0)>0.0D+00 ) go to 110
01196       ip3 = ipl(3*il2-1)
01197       x3 = xd(ip3)
01198       y3 = yd(ip3)
01199       if (spdt(x3,y3,x2,y2,x0,y0)<=0.0D+00 ) go to 170
01200 !
01201 !  Locate inside the data area.
01202 !  Determine the section in which the point in question lies.
01203 !
01204   110 isc = 1
01205       if (x0>=xs1) isc = isc + 1
01206       if (x0>=xs2) isc = isc + 1
01207       if (y0>=ys1) isc = isc + 3
01208       if (y0>=ys2) isc = isc + 3
01209 !
01210 !  Search through the triangles associated with the section.
01211 !
01212       ntsci = ntsc(isc)
01213       if (ntsci<=0) go to 130
01214       jiwk = -9 + isc
01215 
01216       do 120 itsc = 1,ntsci
01217         jiwk = jiwk + 9
01218         it0 = iwk(jiwk)
01219         jwk = it0*4
01220         if (x0<wk(jwk-3)) go to 120
01221         if (x0>wk(jwk-2)) go to 120
01222         if (y0<wk(jwk-1)) go to 120
01223         if (y0>wk(jwk)) go to 120
01224         it0t3 = it0*3
01225         ip1 = ipt(it0t3-2)
01226         x1 = xd(ip1)
01227         y1 = yd(ip1)
01228         ip2 = ipt(it0t3-1)
01229         x2 = xd(ip2)
01230         y2 = yd(ip2)
01231         if (side(x1,y1,x2,y2,x0,y0)<0.0D+00 ) go to 120
01232         ip3 = ipt(it0t3)
01233         x3 = xd(ip3)
01234         y3 = yd(ip3)
01235         if (side(x2,y2,x3,y3,x0,y0)<0.0D+00 ) go to 120
01236         if (side(x3,y3,x1,y1,x0,y0)<0.0D+00 ) go to 120
01237         go to 170
01238   120 continue
01239 !
01240 !  Locate outside the data area.
01241 !
01242   130 do 150 il1 = 1,nl0
01243         il1t3 = il1*3
01244         ip1 = ipl(il1t3-2)
01245         x1 = xd(ip1)
01246         y1 = yd(ip1)
01247         ip2 = ipl(il1t3-1)
01248         x2 = xd(ip2)
01249         y2 = yd(ip2)
01250         if (spdt(x2,y2,x1,y1,x0,y0)<0.0D+00 ) go to 150
01251         if (spdt(x1,y1,x2,y2,x0,y0)<0.0D+00 ) go to 140
01252         if (side(x1,y1,x2,y2,x0,y0)>0.0D+00 ) go to 150
01253         il2 = il1
01254         go to 160
01255   140   il2 = mod(il1,nl0) + 1
01256         ip3 = ipl(3*il2-1)
01257         x3 = xd(ip3)
01258         y3 = yd(ip3)
01259         if (spdt(x3,y3,x2,y2,x0,y0)<=0.0D+00) go to 160
01260   150 continue
01261 
01262       it0 = 1
01263       go to 170
01264   160 it0 = il1*ntl + il2
01265 !
01266 !  normal exit
01267 !
01268   170 iti = it0
01269       itipv = it0
01270 
01271       return
01272       end subroutine idlctn
01273 
01274 
01275       subroutine idpdrv ( ndp, xd, yd, zd, ncp, ipc, pd )
01276 
01277 !*****************************************************************************80
01278 !
01279 !! IDPDRV estimates first and second partial derivatives at data points.
01280 !
01281 !  Discussion:
01282 !
01283 !    This subroutine estimates partial derivatives of the first and
01284 !    second order at the data points.
01285 !
01286 !  Modified:
01287 !
01288 !    24 August 2007
01289 !
01290 !  Author:
01291 !
01292 !    Hiroshi Akima
01293 !
01294 !  References:
01295 !
01296 !    Hiroshi Akima,
01297 !    Algorithm 526:
01298 !    A Method of Bivariate Interpolation and Smooth Surface Fitting
01299 !    for Values Given at Irregularly Distributed Points,
01300 !    ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software,
01301 !    Volume 4, Number 2, June 1978, pages 160-164.
01302 !
01303 !    Hiroshi Akima,
01304 !    On Estimating Partial Derivatives for Bivariate Interpolation
01305 !    of Scattered Data,
01306 !    Rocky Mountain Journal of Mathematics,
01307 !    Volume 14, Number 1, Winter 1984, pages 41-51.
01308 !
01309 !  Parameters:
01310 !
01311 !    Input, integer NDP, the number of data points.
01312 !    4 < =  NDP.
01313 !
01314 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XD(NDP), Y(NDP), Z(NDP), the X, Y and
01315 !    Z coordinates of the data points.
01316 !
01317 !    Input, integer NCP, the number of additional data points used for
01318 !    estimating partial derivatives at each data point,
01319 !
01320 !    Input, integer IPC(NCP*NDP), the indices of NCP data points closest to
01321 !    each of the NDP data points.
01322 !
01323 !    Output, real ( kind = 8 ) PD(5*NDP), the estimated ZX, ZY, ZXX, ZXY,
01324 !    and ZYY values at the Ith data point are to be stored as the
01325 !    (5*I-4)th, (5*I-3)rd, (5*I-2)nd, (5*I-1)st and (5*I)th elements,
01326 !    respectively, where I = 1, 2, ..., NDP.
01327 !
01328   implicit none
01329 
01330   integer ncp
01331   integer ndp
01332 
01333   real ( kind = 8 ) dnmx
01334   real ( kind = 8 ) dnmxx
01335   real ( kind = 8 ) dnmxy
01336   real ( kind = 8 ) dnmy
01337   real ( kind = 8 ) dnmyx
01338   real ( kind = 8 ) dnmyy
01339   real ( kind = 8 ) dnmz
01340   real ( kind = 8 ) dx1
01341   real ( kind = 8 ) dx2
01342   real ( kind = 8 ) dy1
01343   real ( kind = 8 ) dy2
01344   real ( kind = 8 ) dz1
01345   real ( kind = 8 ) dz2
01346   real ( kind = 8 ) dzx1
01347   real ( kind = 8 ) dzx2
01348   real ( kind = 8 ) dzy1
01349   real ( kind = 8 ) dzy2
01350   integer ic1
01351   integer ic2
01352   integer ic2mn
01353   integer idp
01354   integer ip0
01355   integer ipc(ncp*ndp)
01356   integer ipi
01357   integer jipc
01358   integer jipc0
01359   integer jpd
01360   integer jpd0
01361   integer ncp0
01362   integer ncpm1
01363   integer ndp0
01364   real ( kind = 8 ) nmx
01365   real ( kind = 8 ) nmxx
01366   real ( kind = 8 ) nmxy
01367   real ( kind = 8 ) nmy
01368   real ( kind = 8 ) nmyy
01369   real ( kind = 8 ) nmyx
01370   real ( kind = 8 ) nmz
01371   real ( kind = 8 ) pd(5*ndp)
01372   real ( kind = 8 ) x0
01373   real ( kind = 8 ) xd(ndp)
01374   real ( kind = 8 ) y0
01375   real ( kind = 8 ) yd(ndp)
01376   real ( kind = 8 ) z0
01377   real ( kind = 8 ) zd(ndp)
01378   real ( kind = 8 ) zx0
01379   real ( kind = 8 ) zy0
01380 !
01381 !  Preliminary processing.
01382 !
01383   ndp0 = ndp
01384   ncp0 = ncp
01385   ncpm1 = ncp0-1
01386 !
01387 !  Estimation of ZX and ZY.
01388 !
01389       do 24  ip0 = 1,ndp0
01390 
01391         x0 = xd(ip0)
01392         y0 = yd(ip0)
01393         z0 = zd(ip0)
01394         nmx = 0.0D+00
01395         nmy = 0.0D+00
01396         nmz = 0.0D+00
01397         jipc0 = ncp0*(ip0-1)
01398 
01399         do 23  ic1 = 1,ncpm1
01400 
01401           jipc = jipc0+ic1
01402           ipi = ipc(jipc)
01403           dx1 = xd(ipi)-x0
01404           dy1 = yd(ipi)-y0
01405           dz1 = zd(ipi)-z0
01406           ic2mn = ic1+1
01407 
01408           do ic2 = ic2mn,ncp0
01409 
01410             jipc = jipc0+ic2
01411             ipi = ipc(jipc)
01412             dx2 = xd(ipi)-x0
01413             dy2 = yd(ipi)-y0
01414             dnmz = dx1*dy2-dy1*dx2
01415 
01416             if ( dnmz == 0.0D+00 ) then
01417               cycle
01418             end if
01419 
01420             dz2 = zd(ipi)-z0
01421             dnmx = dy1*dz2-dz1*dy2
01422             dnmy = dz1*dx2-dx1*dz2
01423 
01424             if ( dnmz < 0.0D+00 ) then
01425               dnmx = -dnmx
01426               dnmy = -dnmy
01427               dnmz = -dnmz
01428             end if
01429 
01430             nmx = nmx+dnmx
01431             nmy = nmy+dnmy
01432             nmz = nmz+dnmz
01433 
01434           end do
01435 
01436    23   continue
01437 
01438         jpd0 = 5*ip0
01439         pd(jpd0-4) = -nmx/nmz
01440         pd(jpd0-3) = -nmy/nmz
01441 
01442    24 continue
01443 !
01444 !  Estimation of ZXX, ZXY, and ZYY.
01445 !
01446    30 continue
01447 
01448       do ip0 = 1,ndp0
01449 
01450         jpd0 = jpd0+5
01451         x0 = xd(ip0)
01452         jpd0 = 5*ip0
01453         y0 = yd(ip0)
01454         zx0 = pd(jpd0-4)
01455         zy0 = pd(jpd0-3)
01456 
01457         nmxx = 0.0D+00
01458         nmxy = 0.0D+00
01459         nmyx = 0.0D+00
01460         nmyy = 0.0D+00
01461         nmz  = 0.0D+00
01462 
01463         jipc0 = ncp0*(ip0-1)
01464 
01465         do ic1 = 1,ncpm1
01466 
01467           jipc = jipc0+ic1
01468           ipi = ipc(jipc)
01469           dx1 = xd(ipi)-x0
01470           dy1 = yd(ipi)-y0
01471           jpd = 5*ipi
01472           dzx1 = pd(jpd-4)-zx0
01473           dzy1 = pd(jpd-3)-zy0
01474           ic2mn = ic1+1
01475 
01476           do ic2 = ic2mn,ncp0
01477 
01478             jipc = jipc0+ic2
01479             ipi = ipc(jipc)
01480             dx2 = xd(ipi)-x0
01481             dy2 = yd(ipi)-y0
01482             dnmz  = dx1*dy2 -dy1*dx2
01483 
01484             if ( dnmz == 0.0D+00 ) then
01485               cycle
01486             end if
01487 
01488             jpd = 5 * ipi
01489             dzx2 = pd(jpd-4) - zx0
01490             dzy2 = pd(jpd-3) - zy0
01491             dnmxx = dy1 * dzx2 - dzx1 * dy2
01492             dnmxy = dzx1 * dx2 - dx1 * dzx2
01493             dnmyx = dy1 * dzy2 - dzy1 * dy2
01494             dnmyy = dzy1 * dx2 - dx1 * dzy2
01495 
01496             if ( dnmz < 0.0D+00 ) then
01497               dnmxx = -dnmxx
01498               dnmxy = -dnmxy
01499               dnmyx = -dnmyx
01500               dnmyy = -dnmyy
01501               dnmz  = -dnmz
01502             end if
01503 
01504             nmxx = nmxx+dnmxx
01505             nmxy = nmxy+dnmxy
01506             nmyx = nmyx+dnmyx
01507             nmyy = nmyy+dnmyy
01508             nmz  = nmz +dnmz
01509 
01510           end do
01511 
01512         end do
01513 
01514         pd(jpd0-2) = - nmxx / nmz
01515         pd(jpd0-1) = - ( nmxy + nmyx ) / ( 2.0D+00 * nmz )
01516         pd(jpd0)   = - nmyy / nmz
01517 
01518       end do
01519 
01520       return
01521       end subroutine idpdrv
01522 
01523 
01524       subroutine idptip ( xd, yd, zd, nt, ipt, nl, ipl, pdd, iti, xii, yii, zii )
01525 
01526 !*****************************************************************************80
01527 !
01528 !! IDPTIP performs interpolation, determining a value of Z given X and Y.
01529 !
01530 !  Discussion:
01531 !
01532 !    This subroutine performs punctual interpolation or extrapolation
01533 !    that is, determines the Z value at a point.
01534 !
01535 !  Modified:
01536 !
01537 !    24 August 2007
01538 !
01539 !  Author:
01540 !
01541 !    Hiroshi Akima
01542 !
01543 !  References:
01544 !
01545 !    Hiroshi Akima,
01546 !    Algorithm 526:
01547 !    A Method of Bivariate Interpolation and Smooth Surface Fitting
01548 !    for Values Given at Irregularly Distributed Points,
01549 !    ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software,
01550 !    Volume 4, Number 2, June 1978, pages 160-164.
01551 !
01552 !    Hiroshi Akima,
01553 !    On Estimating Partial Derivatives for Bivariate Interpolation
01554 !    of Scattered Data,
01555 !    Rocky Mountain Journal of Mathematics,
01556 !    Volume 14, Number 1, Winter 1984, pages 41-51.
01557 !
01558 !  Parameters:
01559 !
01560 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XD(NDP), Y(NDP), Z(NDP), the X, Y and Z
01561 !    coordinates of the data points.
01562 !
01563 !    Input, integer NT, the number of triangles.
01564 !
01565 !    Input, integer IPT(3*NT), the point numbers of the vertexes of
01566 !    the triangles.
01567 !
01568 !    Input, integer NL, the number of border line segments.
01569 !
01570 !    Input, integer IPL(3*NL), the point numbers of the end points of the
01571 !    border line segments and their respective triangle numbers,
01572 !
01573 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) PDD(5*NDP). the partial derivatives at
01574 !    the data points,
01575 !
01576 !    Input, integer ITI, triangle number of the triangle in which lies
01577 !    the point for which interpolation is to be performed,
01578 !
01579 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XII, YII, the X and Y coordinates of the
01580 !    point for which interpolation is to be performed.
01581 !
01582 !    Output, real ( kind = 8 ) ZII, the interpolated Z value.
01583 !
01584   implicit none
01585 
01586   integer nl
01587   integer nt
01588 
01589   real ( kind = 8 ) a
01590   real ( kind = 8 ) aa
01591   real ( kind = 8 ) ab
01592   real ( kind = 8 ) ac
01593   real ( kind = 8 ) act2
01594   real ( kind = 8 ) ad
01595   real ( kind = 8 ) adbc
01596   real ( kind = 8 ) ap
01597   real ( kind = 8 ) b
01598   real ( kind = 8 ) bb
01599   real ( kind = 8 ) bc
01600   real ( kind = 8 ) bdt2
01601   real ( kind = 8 ) bp
01602   real ( kind = 8 ) c
01603   real ( kind = 8 ) cc
01604   real ( kind = 8 ) cd
01605   real ( kind = 8 ) cp
01606   real ( kind = 8 ) csuv
01607   real ( kind = 8 ) d
01608   real ( kind = 8 ) dd
01609   real ( kind = 8 ) dlt
01610   real ( kind = 8 ) dp
01611   real ( kind = 8 ) dx
01612   real ( kind = 8 ) dy
01613   real ( kind = 8 ) g1
01614   real ( kind = 8 ) g2
01615   real ( kind = 8 ) h1
01616   real ( kind = 8 ) h2
01617   real ( kind = 8 ) h3
01618   integer i
01619   integer idp
01620   integer il1
01621   integer il2
01622   integer ipl(3*nl)
01623   integer ipt(3*nt)
01624   integer it0
01625   integer iti
01626   integer itpv
01627   integer jipl
01628   integer jipt
01629   integer jpd
01630   integer jpdd
01631   integer kpd
01632   real ( kind = 8 ) lu
01633   real ( kind = 8 ) lv
01634   integer ntl
01635   real ( kind = 8 ) p0
01636   real ( kind = 8 ) p00
01637   real ( kind = 8 ) p01
01638   real ( kind = 8 ) p02
01639   real ( kind = 8 ) p03
01640   real ( kind = 8 ) p04
01641   real ( kind = 8 ) p05
01642   real ( kind = 8 ) p1
01643   real ( kind = 8 ) p10
01644   real ( kind = 8 ) p11
01645   real ( kind = 8 ) p12
01646   real ( kind = 8 ) p13
01647   real ( kind = 8 ) p14
01648   real ( kind = 8 ) p2
01649   real ( kind = 8 ) p20
01650   real ( kind = 8 ) p21
01651   real ( kind = 8 ) p22
01652   real ( kind = 8 ) p23
01653   real ( kind = 8 ) p3
01654   real ( kind = 8 ) p30
01655   real ( kind = 8 ) p31
01656   real ( kind = 8 ) p32
01657   real ( kind = 8 ) p4
01658   real ( kind = 8 ) p40
01659   real ( kind = 8 ) p41
01660   real ( kind = 8 ) p5
01661   real ( kind = 8 ) p50
01662   real ( kind = 8 ) pd(15)
01663   real ( kind = 8 ) pdd(*)
01664   real ( kind = 8 ) thsv
01665   real ( kind = 8 ) thus
01666   real ( kind = 8 ) thuv
01667   real ( kind = 8 ) thxu
01668   real ( kind = 8 ) u
01669   real ( kind = 8 ) v
01670   real ( kind = 8 ) x(3)
01671   real ( kind = 8 ) x0
01672   real ( kind = 8 ) xd(*)
01673   real ( kind = 8 ) xii
01674   real ( kind = 8 ) y(3)
01675   real ( kind = 8 ) y0
01676   real ( kind = 8 ) yd(*)
01677   real ( kind = 8 ) yii
01678   real ( kind = 8 ) z(3)
01679   real ( kind = 8 ) zd(*)
01680   real ( kind = 8 ) zii
01681   real ( kind = 8 ) zu(3)
01682   real ( kind = 8 ) zuu(3)
01683   real ( kind = 8 ) zuv(3)
01684   real ( kind = 8 ) zv(3)
01685   real ( kind = 8 ) zvv(3)
01686 
01687   save /idpi/
01688 
01689   common/idpi/itpv
01690 
01691   equivalence (p5,p50)
01692 !
01693 !  Preliminary processing.
01694 !
01695       it0 = iti
01696       ntl = nt+nl
01697       if(it0<=ntl)      go to 20
01698       il1 = it0/ntl
01699       il2 = it0-il1*ntl
01700       if(il1==il2)      go to 40
01701       go to 60
01702 !
01703 !  Calculation of ZII by interpolation.
01704 !  Check if the necessary coefficients have been calculated.
01705 !
01706    20 if(it0==itpv)     go to 30
01707 !
01708 !  Load coordinate and partial derivative values at the vertices.
01709 !
01710    21 jipt = 3*(it0-1)
01711       jpd = 0
01712 
01713       do i = 1,3
01714 
01715         jipt = jipt+1
01716         idp = ipt(jipt)
01717         x(i) = xd(idp)
01718         y(i) = yd(idp)
01719         z(i) = zd(idp)
01720         jpdd = 5*(idp-1)
01721 
01722         do kpd = 1,5
01723           jpd = jpd+1
01724           jpdd = jpdd+1
01725           pd(jpd) = pdd(jpdd)
01726         end do
01727 
01728       end do
01729 !
01730 !  Determine the coefficients for the coordinate system
01731 !  transformation from the XY system to the UV system
01732 !  and vice versa.
01733 !
01734    24 x0 = x(1)
01735       y0 = y(1)
01736       a = x(2)-x0
01737       b = x(3)-x0
01738       c = y(2)-y0
01739       d = y(3)-y0
01740       ad = a*d
01741       bc = b*c
01742       dlt = ad-bc
01743       ap =  d/dlt
01744       bp = -b/dlt
01745       cp = -c/dlt
01746       dp =  a/dlt
01747 !
01748 !  Convert the partial derivatives at the vertexes of the
01749 !  triangle for the UV coordinate system.
01750 !
01751    25 aa = a*a
01752       act2 = 2.0D+00 *a*c
01753       cc = c*c
01754       ab = a*b
01755       adbc = ad+bc
01756       cd = c*d
01757       bb = b*b
01758       bdt2 = 2.0D+00 *b*d
01759       dd = d*d
01760 
01761       do i = 1,3
01762         jpd = 5*i
01763         zu(i) = a*pd(jpd-4)+c*pd(jpd-3)
01764         zv(i) = b*pd(jpd-4)+d*pd(jpd-3)
01765         zuu(i) = aa*pd(jpd-2)+act2*pd(jpd-1)+cc*pd(jpd)
01766         zuv(i) = ab*pd(jpd-2)+adbc*pd(jpd-1)+cd*pd(jpd)
01767         zvv(i) = bb*pd(jpd-2)+bdt2*pd(jpd-1)+dd*pd(jpd)
01768       end do
01769 !
01770 !  Calculate the coefficients of the polynomial.
01771 !
01772    27 p00 = z(1)
01773       p10 = zu(1)
01774       p01 = zv(1)
01775       p20 = 0.5D+00*zuu(1)
01776       p11 = zuv(1)
01777       p02 = 0.5D+00*zvv(1)
01778       h1 = z(2)-p00-p10-p20
01779       h2 = zu(2)-p10-zuu(1)
01780       h3 = zuu(2)-zuu(1)
01781       p30 =  10.0D+00*h1-4.0D+00*h2+0.5D+00*h3
01782       p40 = -15.0D+00*h1+7.0D+00*h2        -h3
01783       p50 =   6.0D+00*h1-3.0D+00*h2+0.5D+00*h3
01784       h1 = z(3)-p00-p01-p02
01785       h2 = zv(3)-p01-zvv(1)
01786       h3 = zvv(3)-zvv(1)
01787       p03 =  10.0D+00*h1-4.0D+00*h2+0.5D+00*h3
01788       p04 = -15.0D+00*h1+7.0D+00*h2        -h3
01789       p05 =   6.0D+00*h1-3.0D+00*h2+0.5D+00*h3
01790       lu = sqrt(aa+cc)
01791       lv = sqrt(bb+dd)
01792       thxu = atan2(c,a)
01793       thuv = atan2(d,b)-thxu
01794       csuv = cos(thuv)
01795       p41 = 5.0D+00*lv*csuv/lu*p50
01796       p14 = 5.0D+00*lu*csuv/lv*p05
01797       h1 = zv(2)-p01-p11-p41
01798       h2 = zuv(2)-p11-4.0D+00*p41
01799       p21 =  3.0D+00*h1-h2
01800       p31 = -2.0D+00*h1+h2
01801       h1 = zu(3)-p10-p11-p14
01802       h2 = zuv(3)-p11-4.0D+00*p14
01803       p12 =  3.0D+00*h1-h2
01804       p13 = -2.0D+00*h1+h2
01805       thus = atan2(d-c,b-a)-thxu
01806       thsv = thuv-thus
01807       aa =  sin(thsv)/lu
01808       bb = -cos(thsv)/lu
01809       cc =  sin(thus)/lv
01810       dd =  cos(thus)/lv
01811       ac = aa*cc
01812       ad = aa*dd
01813       bc = bb*cc
01814       g1 = aa*ac*(3.0D+00*bc+2.0D+00*ad)
01815       g2 = cc*ac*(3.0D+00*ad+2.0D+00*bc)
01816       h1 = -aa*aa*aa*(5.0D+00*aa*bb*p50+(4.0D+00*bc+ad)*p41) &
01817            -cc*cc*cc*(5.0D+00*cc*dd*p05+(4.0D+00*ad+bc)*p14)
01818       h2 = 0.5D+00*zvv(2)-p02-p12
01819       h3 = 0.5D+00*zuu(3)-p20-p21
01820       p22 = (g1*h2+g2*h3-h1)/(g1+g2)
01821       p32 = h2-p22
01822       p23 = h3-p22
01823       itpv = it0
01824 !
01825 !  Convert XII and YII to UV system.
01826 !
01827    30 dx = xii-x0
01828       dy = yii-y0
01829       u = ap*dx+bp*dy
01830       v = cp*dx+dp*dy
01831 !
01832 !  Evaluate the polynomial.
01833 !
01834    31 p0 = p00+v*(p01+v*(p02+v*(p03+v*(p04+v*p05))))
01835       p1 = p10+v*(p11+v*(p12+v*(p13+v*p14)))
01836       p2 = p20+v*(p21+v*(p22+v*p23))
01837       p3 = p30+v*(p31+v*p32)
01838       p4 = p40+v*p41
01839       zii = p0+u*(p1+u*(p2+u*(p3+u*(p4+u*p5))))
01840       return
01841 !
01842 !  Calculation of zii by extrapolation in the rectangle.
01843 !  Check if the necessary coefficients have been calculated.
01844 !
01845    40 if(it0==itpv)     go to 50
01846 !
01847 !  Load coordinate and partial derivative values at the end
01848 !  points of the border line segment.
01849 !
01850    41 jipl = 3*(il1-1)
01851       jpd = 0
01852 
01853       do i = 1,2
01854 
01855         jipl = jipl+1
01856         idp = ipl(jipl)
01857         x(i) = xd(idp)
01858         y(i) = yd(idp)
01859         z(i) = zd(idp)
01860         jpdd = 5*(idp-1)
01861 
01862         do kpd = 1,5
01863           jpd = jpd+1
01864           jpdd = jpdd+1
01865           pd(jpd) = pdd(jpdd)
01866         end do
01867 
01868       end do
01869 !
01870 !  Determine the coefficients for the coordinate system
01871 !  transformation from the XY system to the UV system
01872 !  and vice versa.
01873 !
01874    44 x0 = x(1)
01875       y0 = y(1)
01876       a = y(2)-y(1)
01877       b = x(2)-x(1)
01878       c = -b
01879       d = a
01880       ad = a*d
01881       bc = b*c
01882       dlt = ad-bc
01883       ap =  d/dlt
01884       bp = -b/dlt
01885       cp = -bp
01886       dp =  ap
01887 !
01888 !  Convert the partial derivatives at the end points of the
01889 !  border line segment for the UV coordinate system.
01890 !
01891    45 aa = a*a
01892       act2 = 2.0D+00*a*c
01893       cc = c*c
01894       ab = a*b
01895       adbc = ad+bc
01896       cd = c*d
01897       bb = b*b
01898       bdt2 = 2.0D+00*b*d
01899       dd = d*d
01900 
01901       do i = 1,2
01902         jpd = 5*i
01903         zu(i) = a*pd(jpd-4)+c*pd(jpd-3)
01904         zv(i) = b*pd(jpd-4)+d*pd(jpd-3)
01905         zuu(i) = aa*pd(jpd-2)+act2*pd(jpd-1)+cc*pd(jpd)
01906         zuv(i) = ab*pd(jpd-2)+adbc*pd(jpd-1)+cd*pd(jpd)
01907         zvv(i) = bb*pd(jpd-2)+bdt2*pd(jpd-1)+dd*pd(jpd)
01908       end do
01909 !
01910 !  Calculate the coefficients of the polynomial.
01911 !
01912    47 p00 = z(1)
01913       p10 = zu(1)
01914       p01 = zv(1)
01915       p20 = 0.5D+00*zuu(1)
01916       p11 = zuv(1)
01917       p02 = 0.5D+00*zvv(1)
01918       h1 = z(2)-p00-p01-p02
01919       h2 = zv(2)-p01-zvv(1)
01920       h3 = zvv(2)-zvv(1)
01921       p03 =  10.0D+00*h1-4.0D+00*h2+0.5D+00*h3
01922       p04 = -15.0D+00*h1+7.0D+00*h2        -h3
01923       p05 =   6.0D+00*h1-3.0D+00*h2+0.5D+00*h3
01924       h1 = zu(2)-p10-p11
01925       h2 = zuv(2)-p11
01926       p12 =  3.0D+00*h1-h2
01927       p13 = -2.0D+00*h1+h2
01928       p21 = 0.0D+00
01929       p23 = -zuu(2)+zuu(1)
01930       p22 = -1.5D+00*p23
01931       itpv = it0
01932 !
01933 !  Convert XII and YII to UV system.
01934 !
01935    50 continue
01936 
01937       dx = xii-x0
01938       dy = yii-y0
01939       u = ap*dx+bp*dy
01940       v = cp*dx+dp*dy
01941 !
01942 !  Evaluate the polynomial.
01943 !
01944    51 continue
01945 
01946       p0 = p00+v*(p01+v*(p02+v*(p03+v*(p04+v*p05))))
01947       p1 = p10+v*(p11+v*(p12+v*p13))
01948       p2 = p20+v*(p21+v*(p22+v*p23))
01949       zii = p0+u*(p1+u*p2)
01950       return
01951 !
01952 !  Calculation of ZII by extrapolation in the triangle.
01953 !  Check if the necessary coefficients have been calculated.
01954 !
01955    60 continue
01956 
01957       if ( it0 == itpv ) then
01958         go to 70
01959       end if
01960 !
01961 !  Load coordinate and partial derivative values at the vertex
01962 !  of the triangle.
01963 !
01964    61 jipl = 3*il2-2
01965       idp = ipl(jipl)
01966       x(1) = xd(idp)
01967       y(1) = yd(idp)
01968       z(1) = zd(idp)
01969       jpdd = 5*(idp-1)
01970 
01971       do kpd = 1,5
01972         jpdd = jpdd+1
01973         pd(kpd) = pdd(jpdd)
01974       end do
01975 !
01976 !  Calculate the coefficients of the polynomial.
01977 !
01978       p00 = z(1)
01979       p10 = pd(1)
01980       p01 = pd(2)
01981       p20 = 0.5D+00*pd(3)
01982       p11 = pd(4)
01983       p02 = 0.5D+00*pd(5)
01984       itpv = it0
01985 !
01986 !  Convert XII and YII to UV system.
01987 !
01988    70 continue
01989 
01990       u = xii-x(1)
01991       v = yii-y(1)
01992 !
01993 !  Evaluate the polynomial.
01994 !
01995       p0 = p00+v*(p01+v*p02)
01996       p1 = p10+v*p11
01997       zii = p0+u*(p1+u*p20)
01998 
01999       return
02000       end subroutine idptip
02001 
02002 
02003       subroutine idsfft ( md, ncp, ndp, xd, yd, zd, nxi, nyi, xi, yi, zi, iwk, wk )
02004 
02005 !*****************************************************************************80
02006 !
02007 !! IDSFFT fits a smooth surface Z(X,Y) given irregular (X,Y,Z) data.
02008 !
02009 !  Discussion:
02010 !
02011 !    This subroutine performs smooth surface fitting when the projections
02012 !    of the data points in the XY plane are irregularly
02013 !    distributed in the plane.
02014 !
02015 !    The very first call to this subroutine and the call with a new
02016 !    NCP value, a new NDP value, or new contents of the XD and
02017 !    YD arrays must be made with MD = 1.  The call with MD = 2 must be
02018 !    preceded by another call with the same NCP and NDP values and
02019 !    with the same contents of the XD and YD arrays.  The call with
02020 !    MD = 3 must be preceded by another call with the same NCP, NDP,
02021 !    NXI, and NYI values and with the same contents of the XD, YD,
02022 !    XI, and YI arrays.  Between the call with MD = 2 or MD = 3 and its
02023 !    preceding call, the IWK and WK arrays must not be disturbed.
02024 !    Use of a value between 3 and 5 (inclusive) for NCP is recommended
02025 !    unless there is evidence that dictate otherwise.
02026 !
02027 !  Modified:
02028 !
02029 !    24 August 2007
02030 !
02031 !  Author:
02032 !
02033 !    Hiroshi Akima
02034 !
02035 !  References:
02036 !
02037 !    Hiroshi Akima,
02038 !    Algorithm 526:
02039 !    A Method of Bivariate Interpolation and Smooth Surface Fitting
02040 !    for Values Given at Irregularly Distributed Points,
02041 !    ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software,
02042 !    Volume 4, Number 2, June 1978, pages 160-164.
02043 !
02044 !    Hiroshi Akima,
02045 !    On Estimating Partial Derivatives for Bivariate Interpolation
02046 !    of Scattered Data,
02047 !    Rocky Mountain Journal of Mathematics,
02048 !    Volume 14, Number 1, Winter 1984, pages 41-51.
02049 !
02050 !  Parameters:
02051 !
02052 !    Input, integer MD, mode of computation (must be 1, 2, or 3,
02053 !    else an error return will occur).
02054 !    * 1, if this is the first call to this routine, or if the value of
02055 !    NDP has been changed from the previous call, or if the contents of
02056 !    the XD or YD arrays have been changed from the previous call.
02057 !    * 2, if the values of NDP and the XD, YD arrays are unchanged from
02058 !    the previous call, but new values for XI, YI are being used.  If
02059 !    MD = 2 and NDP has been changed since the previous call to IDSFFT,
02060 !    an error return occurs.
02061 !    * 3, if the values of NDP, NXI, NYI, XD, YD, XI, YI are unchanged
02062 !    from the previous call, i.e. if the only change on input to idsfft
02063 !    is in the ZD array.  If MD = 3 and NDP, nxi or nyi has been changed
02064 !    since the previous call to IDSFFT, an error return occurs.
02065 !    Between the call with MD = 2 or MD = 3 and the preceding call, the
02066 !    IWK and WK work arrays should not be disturbed.
02067 !
02068 !    Input, integer NCP, the number of data points used to estimate partial
02069 !    derivatives.  2 <= NCP < NDP.  A value between 3 and 5 is recommended.
02070 !
02071 !    Input, integer NDP, the number of data points.  NDP must be at least 4.
02072 !
02073 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XD(NDP), Y(NDP), Z(NDP), the X, Y and Z
02074 !    coordinates of the data points.
02075 !
02076 !    Input, integer NXI, NYI, the number of output grid points in the
02077 !    X and Y directions.  NXI and NYI must each be at least 1.
02078 !
02079 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XI(NXI), YI(NYI), the X and Y coordinates
02080 !    of the grid points.
02081 !
02082 !    Output, real ( kind = 8 ) ZI(NXI,NYI), contains the interpolated Z
02083 !    values at the grid points.
02084 !
02085 !    Workspace, integer IWK(max(31,27+NCP)*NDP+NXI*NYI).
02086 !
02087 !    Workspace, real ( kind = 8 ) WK(5*NDP).
02088 !
02089   implicit none
02090 
02091   integer ncp
02092   integer ndp
02093   integer nxi
02094   integer nyi
02095 
02096   integer il1
02097   integer il2
02098   integer iti
02099   integer itpv
02100   integer iwk(max(31,27+ncp)*ndp+nxi*nyi)
02101   integer ixi
02102   integer iyi
02103   integer izi
02104   integer jig0mx
02105   integer jig0mn
02106   integer jig1mx
02107   integer jig1mn
02108   integer jigp
02109   integer jngp
02110   integer jwigp
02111   integer jwigp0
02112   integer jwipc
02113   integer jwipl
02114   integer jwipt
02115   integer jwiwl
02116   integer jwiwp
02117   integer jwngp
02118   integer jwngp0
02119   integer md
02120   integer md0
02121   integer ncp0
02122   integer ncppv
02123   integer ndp0
02124   integer ndppv
02125   integer ngp0
02126   integer ngp1
02127   integer nl
02128   integer nngp
02129   integer nt
02130   integer nxi0
02131   integer nxipv
02132   integer nyi0
02133   integer nyipv
02134   real ( kind = 8 ) wk(5*ndp)
02135   real ( kind = 8 ) xd(ndp)
02136   real ( kind = 8 ) xi(nxi)
02137   real ( kind = 8 ) yd(ndp)
02138   real ( kind = 8 ) yi(nyi)
02139   real ( kind = 8 ) zd(ndp)
02140   real ( kind = 8 ) zi(nxi*nyi)
02141 
02142   save /idpi/
02143 
02144   common /idpi/ itpv
02145 !
02146 !  Setting of some input parameters to local variables, for MD = 1, 2, 3.
02147 !
02148   md0 = md
02149   ncp0 = ncp
02150   ndp0 = ndp
02151   nxi0 = nxi
02152   nyi0 = nyi
02153 !
02154 !  Error check, for MD = 1, 2, 3.
02155 !
02156       if(md0<1.or.md0>3)           go to 90
02157       if(ncp0<2.or.ncp0>=ndp0)      go to 90
02158       if(ndp0<4)                      go to 90
02159       if(nxi0<1.or.nyi0<1)         go to 90
02160 
02161       if(md0>=2)        go to 21
02162       iwk(1) = ncp0
02163       iwk(2) = ndp0
02164       go to 22
02165 
02166    21 ncppv = iwk(1)
02167       ndppv = iwk(2)
02168       if(ncp0/=ncppv)   go to 90
02169       if(ndp0/=ndppv)   go to 90
02170 
02171    22 continue
02172 
02173       if(md0>=3)        go to 23
02174       iwk(3) = nxi0
02175       iwk(4) = nyi0
02176       go to 30
02177    23 nxipv = iwk(3)
02178       nyipv = iwk(4)
02179       if(nxi0/=nxipv)   go to 90
02180       if(nyi0/=nyipv)   go to 90
02181 !
02182 !  Allocation of storage areas in the IWK array, for MD = 1,2,3.
02183 !
02184    30 jwipt = 16
02185       jwiwl = 6*ndp0+1
02186       jwngp0 = jwiwl-1
02187       jwipl = 24*ndp0+1
02188       jwiwp = 30*ndp0+1
02189       jwipc = 27*ndp0+1
02190       jwigp0 = max ( 31, 27 + ncp0 ) * ndp0
02191 !
02192 !  Triangulate the XY plane, for MD = 1.
02193 !
02194    40 continue
02195 
02196       if ( md0 == 1 ) then
02197 
02198         call idtang(ndp0,xd,yd,nt,iwk(jwipt),nl,iwk(jwipl), &
02199           iwk(jwiwl),iwk(jwiwp),wk)
02200 
02201         iwk(5) = nt
02202         iwk(6) = nl
02203 
02204         if ( nt == 0 ) then
02205           return
02206         end if
02207 
02208       end if
02209 !
02210 !  Determine NCP points closest to each data point, for MD = 1.
02211 !
02212       if ( md0 == 1 ) then
02213 
02214         call idcldp(ndp0,xd,yd,ncp0,iwk(jwipc))
02215 
02216         if ( iwk(jwipc) == 0 ) then
02217           return
02218         end if
02219 
02220       end if
02221 !
02222 !  Sort output grid points in ascending order of the triangle
02223 !  number and the border line segment number, for md = 1,2.
02224 !
02225       if ( md0 /= 3 ) then
02226         call idgrid(xd,yd,nt,iwk(jwipt),nl,iwk(jwipl),nxi0,nyi0, &
02227           xi,yi,iwk(jwngp0+1),iwk(jwigp0+1))
02228       end if
02229 !
02230 !  Estimate partial derivatives at all data points,
02231 !  for md = 1,2,3.
02232 !
02233       call idpdrv(ndp0,xd,yd,zd,ncp0,iwk(jwipc),wk)
02234 !
02235 !  Interpolate the ZI values, for md = 1,2,3.
02236 !
02237    80 itpv = 0
02238       jig0mx = 0
02239       jig1mn = nxi0*nyi0+1
02240       nngp = nt+2*nl
02241 
02242       do jngp = 1,nngp
02243 
02244         iti = jngp
02245 
02246         if ( nt < jngp ) then
02247           il1 = (jngp-nt+1)/2
02248           il2 = (jngp-nt+2)/2
02249           if(il2>nl)     il2 = 1
02250           iti = il1*(nt+nl)+il2
02251         end if
02252 
02253         jwngp = jwngp0+jngp
02254         ngp0 = iwk(jwngp)
02255 
02256         if ( 0 < ngp0 ) then
02257           jig0mn = jig0mx+1
02258           jig0mx = jig0mx+ngp0
02259 
02260           do jigp = jig0mn,jig0mx
02261 
02262             jwigp = jwigp0+jigp
02263             izi = iwk(jwigp)
02264             iyi = (izi-1)/nxi0+1
02265             ixi = izi-nxi0*(iyi-1)
02266 
02267             call idptip(xd,yd,zd,nt,iwk(jwipt),nl,iwk(jwipl),wk, &
02268               iti,xi(ixi),yi(iyi),zi(izi))
02269 
02270           end do
02271 
02272         end if
02273 
02274         jwngp = jwngp0+2*nngp+1-jngp
02275         ngp1 = iwk(jwngp)
02276 
02277         if ( 0 < ngp1 ) then
02278           jig1mx = jig1mn-1
02279           jig1mn = jig1mn-ngp1
02280 
02281           do jigp = jig1mn,jig1mx
02282 
02283             jwigp = jwigp0+jigp
02284             izi = iwk(jwigp)
02285             iyi = (izi-1)/nxi0+1
02286             ixi = izi-nxi0*(iyi-1)
02287             call idptip(xd,yd,zd,nt,iwk(jwipt),nl,iwk(jwipl),wk, &
02288               iti,xi(ixi),yi(iyi),zi(izi))
02289           end do
02290 
02291         end if
02292 
02293       end do
02294 
02295       return
02296 
02297    90 write ( *, 2090 ) md0,ncp0,ndp0,nxi0,nyi0
02298       return
02299  2090 format(1x/' ***   improper input parameter value(s).'/ &
02300          '   md  = ',i4,10x,'ncp  = ',i6,10x,'ndp  = ',i6, &
02301          10x,'nxi  = ',i6,10x,'nyi  = ',i6/ &
02302          ' error detected in routine   idsfft'/)
02303       end subroutine idsfft
02304 
02305 
02306       subroutine idtang ( ndp, xd, yd, nt, ipt, nl, ipl, iwl, iwp, wk )
02307 
02308 !*****************************************************************************80
02309 !
02310 !! IDTANG performs triangulation.
02311 !
02312 !  Discussion:
02313 !
02314 !    This subroutine performs triangulation.  It divides the XY
02315 !    plane into a number of triangles according to given data
02316 !    points in the plane, determines line segments that form the
02317 !    border of data area, and determines the triangle numbers
02318 !    corresponding to the border line segments.
02319 !
02320 !    At completion, point numbers of the vertexes of each triangle
02321 !    are listed counter-clockwise.  Point numbers of the end points
02322 !    of each border line segment are listed counter-clockwise,
02323 !    listing order of the line segments being counter-clockwise.
02324 !
02325 !  Modified:
02326 !
02327 !    24 August 2007
02328 !
02329 !  Author:
02330 !
02331 !    Hiroshi Akima
02332 !
02333 !  References:
02334 !
02335 !    Hiroshi Akima,
02336 !    Algorithm 526:
02337 !    A Method of Bivariate Interpolation and Smooth Surface Fitting
02338 !    for Values Given at Irregularly Distributed Points,
02339 !    ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software,
02340 !    Volume 4, Number 2, June 1978, pages 160-164.
02341 !
02342 !    Hiroshi Akima,
02343 !    On Estimating Partial Derivatives for Bivariate Interpolation
02344 !    of Scattered Data,
02345 !    Rocky Mountain Journal of Mathematics,
02346 !    Volume 14, Number 1, Winter 1984, pages 41-51.
02347 !
02348 !  Parameters:
02349 !
02350 !    Input, integer NDP, the number of data points.
02351 !
02352 !    Input, real ( kind = 8 ) XD(NDP), Y(NDP), the X and Y coordinates
02353 !    of the data points.
02354 !
02355 !    Output, integer NT, the number of triangles,
02356 !
02357 !    Output, integer IPT(6*NDP-15), where the point numbers of the
02358 !    vertexes of the IT-th triangle are to be stored as entries
02359 !    3*IT-2, 3*IT-1, and 3*IT, for IT = 1 to NT.
02360 !
02361 !    Output, integer NL, the number of border line segments.
02362 !
02363 !    Output, integer IPL(6*NDP), where the point numbers of the end
02364 !    points of the (il)th border line segment and its respective triangle
02365 !    number are to be stored as the (3*il-2)nd, (3*il-1)st, and (3*il)th
02366 !    elements, il = 1,2,..., nl.
02367 !
02368 !    Workspace, integer IWL(18*NDP),
02369 !
02370 !    Workspace, integer IWP(NDP),
02371 !
02372 !    Workspace, real ( kind = 8 ) WK(NDP).
02373 !
02374   implicit none
02375 
02376   integer ndp
02377 
02378   real (kind=T_DBL) ar
02379   real (kind=T_DBL) armn
02380   real (kind=T_DBL) armx
02381   real (kind=T_DBL) dsq12
02382   real (kind=T_DBL) dsqf
02383   real (kind=T_DBL) dsqi
02384   real (kind=T_DBL) dsqmn
02385   real (kind=T_DBL) dsqmx
02386   real (kind=T_DBL) dx
02387   real (kind=T_DBL) dx21
02388   real (kind=T_DBL) dxmn
02389   real (kind=T_DBL) dxmx
02390   real (kind=T_DBL) dy
02391   real (kind=T_DBL) dy21
02392   real (kind=T_DBL) dymn
02393   real (kind=T_DBL) dymx
02394   integer (kind=T_INT) idxchg
02395   integer (kind=T_INT) ilf
02396   integer (kind=T_INT) ilft2
02397   integer (kind=T_INT) ip
02398   integer (kind=T_INT) ip1
02399   integer (kind=T_INT) ip1p1
02400   integer (kind=T_INT) ip2
02401   integer (kind=T_INT) ip3
02402   integer (kind=T_INT) ipl(6*ndp)
02403   integer (kind=T_INT) ipl1
02404   integer (kind=T_INT) ipl2
02405   integer (kind=T_INT) iplj1
02406   integer (kind=T_INT) iplj2
02407   integer (kind=T_INT) ipmn1
02408   integer (kind=T_INT) ipmn2
02409   integer (kind=T_INT) ipt(6*ndp-15)
02410   integer (kind=T_INT) ipt1
02411   integer (kind=T_INT) ipt2
02412   integer (kind=T_INT) ipt3
02413   integer (kind=T_INT) ipti
02414   integer (kind=T_INT) ipti1
02415   integer (kind=T_INT) ipti2
02416   integer (kind=T_INT) irep
02417   integer (kind=T_INT) it
02418   integer (kind=T_INT) it1t3
02419   integer (kind=T_INT) it2t3
02420   integer (kind=T_INT) itf(2)
02421   integer (kind=T_INT) its
02422   integer (kind=T_INT) itt3
02423   integer (kind=T_INT) itt3r
02424   integer (kind=T_INT) iwl(18*ndp)
02425   integer (kind=T_INT) iwp(ndp)
02426   integer (kind=T_INT) jlt3
02427   integer (kind=T_INT) jp
02428   integer (kind=T_INT) jp1
02429   integer (kind=T_INT) jp2
02430   integer (kind=T_INT) jp2t3
02431   integer (kind=T_INT) jp3t3
02432   integer (kind=T_INT) jpc
02433   integer (kind=T_INT) jpmn
02434   integer (kind=T_INT) jpmx
02435   integer (kind=T_INT) jwl
02436   integer (kind=T_INT) jwl1
02437   integer (kind=T_INT) jwl1mn
02438   integer (kind=T_INT) ndp0
02439   integer (kind=T_INT) ndpm1
02440   integer (kind=T_INT) nl
02441   integer (kind=T_INT) nl0
02442   integer (kind=T_INT) nlf
02443   integer (kind=T_INT) nlfc
02444   integer (kind=T_INT) nlft2
02445   integer (kind=T_INT) nln
02446   integer (kind=T_INT) nlnt3
02447   integer (kind=T_INT) nlt3
02448   integer (kind=T_INT), parameter :: nrep = 100
02449   integer (kind=T_INT) nsh
02450   integer (kind=T_INT) nsht3
02451   integer (kind=T_INT) nt
02452   integer (kind=T_INT) nt0
02453   integer (kind=T_INT) ntf
02454   integer (kind=T_INT) ntt3
02455   integer (kind=T_INT) ntt3p3
02456   real (kind=T_DBL), parameter :: ratio = 1.0D-06
02457   real (kind=T_DBL) side
02458   real (kind=T_DBL) u1
02459   real (kind=T_DBL) u2
02460   real (kind=T_DBL) u3
02461   real (kind=T_DBL) v1
02462   real (kind=T_DBL) v2
02463   real (kind=T_DBL) v3
02464   real (kind=T_DBL) wk(ndp)
02465   real (kind=T_DBL) x1
02466   real (kind=T_DBL) xd(ndp)
02467   real (kind=T_DBL) xdmp
02468   real (kind=T_DBL) y1
02469   real (kind=T_DBL) yd(ndp)
02470   real (kind=T_DBL) ydmp
02471 !
02472 !  Statement functions
02473 !
02474       dsqf(u1,v1,u2,v2) = (u2-u1)**2+(v2-v1)**2
02475       side(u1,v1,u2,v2,u3,v3) = (v3-v1)*(u2-u1)-(u3-u1)*(v2-v1)
02476 !
02477 !  Preliminary processing.
02478 !
02479    10 ndp0 = ndp
02480       ndpm1 = ndp0-1
02481       if(ndp0<4)       go to 90
02482 !
02483 !  Determine the closest pair of data points and their midpoint.
02484 !
02485    20 dsqmn = dsqf(xd(1),yd(1),xd(2),yd(2))
02486       ipmn1 = 1
02487       ipmn2 = 2
02488 
02489       do ip1 = 1, ndpm1
02490 
02491         x1 = xd(ip1)
02492         y1 = yd(ip1)
02493         ip1p1 = ip1+1
02494 
02495         do ip2 = ip1p1,ndp0
02496 
02497           dsqi = dsqf(x1,y1,xd(ip2),yd(ip2))
02498           if ( dsqi == 0.0D+00 )      go to 91
02499 
02500           if ( dsqi < dsqmn ) then
02501             dsqmn = dsqi
02502             ipmn1 = ip1
02503             ipmn2 = ip2
02504           end if
02505 
02506         end do
02507 
02508       end do
02509 
02510       dsq12 = dsqmn
02511       xdmp = (xd(ipmn1)+xd(ipmn2))/2.0D+00
02512       ydmp = (yd(ipmn1)+yd(ipmn2))/2.0D+00
02513 !
02514 !  Sort the other (NDP-2) data points in ascending order of
02515 !  distance from the midpoint and store the sorted data point
02516 !  numbers in the IWP array.
02517 !
02518    30 jp1 = 2
02519 
02520       do ip1 = 1,ndp0
02521         if ( ip1 /= ipmn1 .and. ip1 /= ipmn2 ) then
02522           jp1 = jp1+1
02523           iwp(jp1) = ip1
02524           wk(jp1) = dsqf(xdmp,ydmp,xd(ip1),yd(ip1))
02525         end if
02526       end do
02527 
02528       do jp1 = 3,ndpm1
02529 
02530         dsqmn = wk(jp1)
02531         jpmn = jp1
02532 
02533         do jp2 = jp1,ndp0
02534           if ( wk(jp2) < dsqmn ) then
02535             dsqmn = wk(jp2)
02536             jpmn = jp2
02537           end if
02538         end do
02539 
02540         its = iwp(jp1)
02541         iwp(jp1) = iwp(jpmn)
02542         iwp(jpmn) = its
02543         wk(jpmn) = wk(jp1)
02544 
02545       end do
02546 !
02547 !  If necessary, modify the ordering in such a way that the
02548 !  first three data points are not collinear.
02549 !
02550    35 ar = dsq12*ratio
02551       x1 = xd(ipmn1)
02552       y1 = yd(ipmn1)
02553       dx21 = xd(ipmn2)-x1
02554       dy21 = yd(ipmn2)-y1
02555 
02556       do jp = 3,ndp0
02557         ip = iwp(jp)
02558         if(abs((yd(ip)-y1)*dx21-(xd(ip)-x1)*dy21)>ar) &
02559                      go to 37
02560       end do
02561 
02562       go to 92
02563    37 continue
02564 
02565       if ( jp /= 3 ) then
02566 
02567         jpmx = jp
02568         jp = jpmx+1
02569 
02570         do jpc = 4,jpmx
02571           jp = jp-1
02572           iwp(jp) = iwp(jp-1)
02573         end do
02574 
02575         iwp(3) = ip
02576 
02577       end if
02578 !
02579 !  Form the first triangle.  Store point numbers of the vertices
02580 !  of the triangle in the IPT array, and store point numbers
02581 !  of the border line segments and the triangle number in
02582 !  the IPL array.
02583 !
02584       ip1 = ipmn1
02585       ip2 = ipmn2
02586       ip3 = iwp(3)
02587 
02588       if(side(xd(ip1),yd(ip1),xd(ip2),yd(ip2),xd(ip3),yd(ip3)) &
02589            >=0.0D+00)       go to 41
02590 
02591       ip1 = ipmn2
02592       ip2 = ipmn1
02593 
02594    41 continue
02595 
02596       nt0 = 1
02597       ntt3 = 3
02598       ipt(1) = ip1
02599       ipt(2) = ip2
02600       ipt(3) = ip3
02601       nl0 = 3
02602       nlt3 = 9
02603       ipl(1) = ip1
02604       ipl(2) = ip2
02605       ipl(3) = 1
02606       ipl(4) = ip2
02607       ipl(5) = ip3
02608       ipl(6) = 1
02609       ipl(7) = ip3
02610       ipl(8) = ip1
02611       ipl(9) = 1
02612 !
02613 !  Add the remaining (NDP-3) data points, one by one.
02614 !
02615    50 continue
02616 
02617       do 79  jp1 = 4,ndp0
02618 
02619         ip1 = iwp(jp1)
02620         x1 = xd(ip1)
02621         y1 = yd(ip1)
02622 !
02623 !  Determine the visible border line segments.
02624 !
02625         ip2 = ipl(1)
02626         jpmn = 1
02627         dxmn = xd(ip2)-x1
02628         dymn = yd(ip2)-y1
02629         dsqmn = dxmn**2+dymn**2
02630         armn = dsqmn*ratio
02631         jpmx = 1
02632         dxmx = dxmn
02633         dymx = dymn
02634         dsqmx = dsqmn
02635         armx = armn
02636 
02637         do 52  jp2 = 2,nl0
02638           ip2 = ipl(3*jp2-2)
02639           dx = xd(ip2)-x1
02640           dy = yd(ip2)-y1
02641           ar = dy*dxmn-dx*dymn
02642           if(ar>armn)       go to 51
02643           dsqi = dx**2+dy**2
02644           if(ar>=(-armn).and.dsqi>=dsqmn)      go to 51
02645           jpmn = jp2
02646           dxmn = dx
02647           dymn = dy
02648           dsqmn = dsqi
02649           armn = dsqmn*ratio
02650    51     ar = dy*dxmx-dx*dymx
02651           if(ar<(-armx))    go to 52
02652           dsqi = dx**2+dy**2
02653           if(ar<=armx.and.dsqi>=dsqmx)    go to 52
02654           jpmx = jp2
02655           dxmx = dx
02656           dymx = dy
02657           dsqmx = dsqi
02658           armx = dsqmx*ratio
02659 
02660    52   continue
02661 
02662         if(jpmx<jpmn) then
02663           jpmx = jpmx+nl0
